%text All differential equations are not solved in the same way The most efficient way to solve a differential depends on the \underline\text{type of equation} For the types you will encounter, the techniques are summarized below % \begin{align} \begin{tabular}{NN}
\hline \text{Type} & \text{First Step} \\ \hline \frac{dy}{dx} = g(x)\cdot h(y) & \frac{dy}{h(y)} = g(x)\cdot dx \\ & \therefore \int\frac{dy}{h(y)} = \int g(x)\cdot dx \\ \hline \frac{dy}{dx} = g\left(\frac{y}{x}\right) & \text{Let }y = v\cdot x \\ & \therefore \frac{dy}{dx} = v + x\frac{dv}{dx} = g(v)\\ \hline \frac{dy}{dx} + Px = Q & \text{Find the integrating factor} \\ & I(x) = e^{\int P\cdot dx} \\ & \text{Multiply both sides with $I(x)$} \\ \hline \end{tabular} \end{align} %text %
